summary: This chapter emphasizes the importance of managing your email efficiently to maintain productivity and sanity. It introduces practical steps to achieve 'Inbox Zero', such as sorting, filing, and replying to emails systematically. By allocating dedicated time for email tasks and minimizing notifications, you can prevent email from becoming an overwhelming burden. The chapter advocates for a focused approach to email management, allowing for better time management in your daily and weekly routines. Adopting these strategies can lead to less stress and more control over your professional communication.

slides.section_body: Start by sorting through your emails. Focus on separating the important messages from the noise. This initial step sets the foundation for effective email management, allowing you to prioritize tasks that truly matter.
slides.quote: Sorting by sender can help you eradicate irrelevant emails with a single stroke.

slides.section_body: Utilize your email's folder feature to file away non-urgent messages. Organizing emails into designated folders not only keeps your inbox tidy but also allows easy access to important information when needed.
slides.quote: My folders have names like 'Speaking invites' and 'Misc.', perfect for everything that doesn't fit elsewhere.

slides.section_body: Setting aside specific time to reply to emails is vital. Avoid procrastination by addressing simple replies quickly, while noting down more complicated responses for dedicated thinking time later.
slides.quote: Once separated from the herd, many emails will be easy to spot and respond to.

slides.section_body: Aim for Inbox Zero by regularly managing your messages instead of allowing them to pile up. This involves deleting, filing, and responding efficiently, turning email management into a consistent practice.
slides.quote: Butt in the seat, delete, delete, delete.

slides.section_body: Designate specific time slots in your schedule for email management. By focusing solely on emails during these times, you can reduce anxiety and improve the quality of your responses.
slides.quote: Catching up on email can just have its own time slot, where you focus on it, and only it.

slides.section_body: Consider disabling notifications during focused work sessions. This will help you avoid distractions and maintain concentration on the tasks that matter most, ensuring you don’t miss urgent communications.
slides.quote: If you have a Pavlovian reaction to pings, you can turn those notifications off.

slides.section_body: Understand that managing email should not deter you from your primary work duties. Balancing tasks effectively allows for a seamless workflow without letting emails overwhelm your day.
slides.quote: It’s a judgment call between your workflow and your email obligations.

slides.section_body: Time management is crucial in efficiently handling your emails. An organized approach to both time and email results in decreased stress and a more productive work life.
slides.quote: The key is time management, knowing what your regular volume is.

slides.section_body: Develop a personal system that works for you, combining folder organization, scheduled email sessions, and notification management. This unique strategy caters to your specific workflow; customize it to fit your needs.
slides.quote: Create a system that reflects your unique approach to managing both time and tasks.

slides.section_body: Ultimately, the objective is to maintain control over your inbox and your time. By establishing these practices, you will navigate your tasks with greater ease and clarity.
slides.quote: Adopting these strategies can lead to less stress and more control over your professional communication.
